name: Tyla
description:
'''Tyla Laura Seethal''' (born 30 January 2002), [[Mononym|mononymously]] known as '''Tyla''', is a South African singer and songwriter. Her musical style is characterised by a fusion of [[Pop music|pop]] and [[amapiano]], with many publications dubbing her "[[Honorific nicknames in popular music|Queen of Popiano]]". She gained international recognition after the release of her 2023 single "[[Water (Tyla song)|Water]]", which entered the top ten in multiple countries including her native South Africa, the United Kingdom and the United States.

Born and raised in the [[East Rand]] of [[Johannesburg]], Tyla signed with [[Epic Records]] in 2021 following the domestic success of her 2019 debut single, "[[Getting Late (Tyla song)|Getting Late]]". Her song "Water" was the first song by a South African soloist to enter the US [[Billboard Hot 100|''Billboard'' Hot 100]] in 55 years and was awarded the inaugural [[Grammy Awards|Grammy Award]] for [[Grammy Award for Best African Music Performance|Best African Music Performance]]. The single preceded her [[Tyla (album)|self-titled debut album]] (2024), which was released to critical acclaim and moderate commercial success. Subsequent releases include the extended play ''[[WWP (EP)|We Wanna Party]]'' (2025) and the single "[[Chanel (Tyla song)|Chanel]]", which achieved further commercial success.

Tyla is the youngest African artist in history to win a Grammy Award. Her other [[List of awards and nominations received by Tyla|accolades]] include two [[MTV Video Music Awards]], two [[BET Awards]], three [[MTV Europe Music Awards]], among nominations for a [[Brit Awards|BRIT Award]], an [[Ivor Novello Awards|Ivor Novello Award]], a [[Soul Train Music Awards|Soul Train Music Award]] and nine [[South African Music Awards]].
